paper_abstract: In this paper, an innovatory modelling framework is proposed to conduct the uncertainty recovery analysis for the interdependent infrastructure sectors based on the dynamic inoperability input-output model (DIIM). The DIIM captures the inoperability of infrastructure systems, and therefore can easily analyse how perturbations propagate among interconnected infrastructures and how to implement effective mitigation efforts after a disaster. In this paper, based on the random recovery time distribution, we apply the Monte Carlo simulation to obtain the distributions of the economic losses for the critical interdependent infrastructure sectors after a disaster. The proposed method can provide the decision-makers the guidance in making suitable risk-management decisions as well as how the risks can be mitigated, if the disaster cannot be avoided to happen in the first place.
paper_title: The uncertainty recovery analysis for interdependent infrastructure systems using the dynamic inoperability input-output model
